page.title: 02Eastington Village
page.content:
The population of approximately 1500 people is centred on the village of Eastington which consists of a variety of property ranging from the 17th. & 18th. century buildings set along the Bath and Stonehouse roads, to the two modern housing estates.
The first estate was built by the Council during the 1950's on land opposite the Victoria Inn. Extra houses ,including an elderly people's complex, have continued to be added, the latest being built this year - 1985.
The second estate,Swallow Croft was built on land on the East side of the Stonehouse road during the 1970's. Until the infra structure is improved all future development will be restricted to "infill" building.
